items.sentence: You don\'t need to tell me what to do. I already know.
I didn\'t know that soccer was such a dangerous sport.
I didn\'t win, but at least I got a consolation prize.
I don\'t care what people think about the way I dress.
I wonder whether or not Tom is going to do that today.
I wonder whether or not the plane will arrive on time.
I wonder whether or not there really is a Santa Claus.
I had a crowbar in one hand and a hammer in the other.
I have a part-time job working as a Santa at the mall.
I have to make certain Tom knows where he needs to go.
I know an American girl who speaks Japanese very well.
I learned how to ride a bike when I was six years old.
Don\'t forget to brush your teeth before going to bed.
Don\'t pour hot water into the glass or it will crack.
Don\'t you want to know the truth about what happened?
Don\'t you want to know what Tom really thinks of you?
That\'s not something I want to think about right now.
Were you able to do everything you wanted to get done?
Were you able to get any of the information we needed?
He met his English teacher at the station by accident.
If I leave my suitcase here, will you watch it for me?
If you really want to know, all you have to do is ask.
What\'s the most popular spectator sport in Australia?
What\'s your favorite question to ask on a first date?
I don\'t have a lot of money, but I get along somehow.
Tom told me that I could keep the book if I wanted it.
Tom told me that he could come on any day but Tuesday.
Tom took one last look around the room before he left.
Tom took the bottle from Mary and looked at the label.
Tom tried to discourage Mary from going out with John.
Let\'s not forget that Tom is only thirteen years old.
Let\'s park the car here and walk the rest of the way.
Let\'s try to settle our differences once and for all.
Many inmates on death row say they don\'t want to die.
I\'m not sure yet, but I think I\'ll become a teacher.
More than 40 percent of the students go to university.
My father will be back at the beginning of next month.
When you\'re in a hurry, it\'s easy to make a mistake.
Don\'t make any noise or you\'ll scare the birds away.
Tom does a pretty good job of forecasting the weather.
Tom promised Mary that he would never see Alice again.
Tom pulled a bottle of bourbon out of his desk drawer.
Tom put a cup of coffee on the table in front of Mary.
Tom put off his wedding because of a traffic accident.
Tom quietly opened the door and tiptoed into the room.
I convinced Tom that he should go to Boston with Mary.
If you need my advice, I\'d be glad to give it to you.
Tom never seems to get upset no matter what Mary does.
Tom read a magazine while waiting for Mary to show up.
Tom solved the puzzle after Mary gave him a few hints.
